labkipackmanager-desc: Import Labki .wiki content packs from Git repositories and manage installed content.
labkipackmanager-summary: Manage and import Labki content packs into this wiki.
labkipackmanager-special-placeholder: This is a placeholder for the LabkiPackManager import UI.
right-labkipackmanager-manage: Manage Labki content packs and related data
labkipackmanager-error-dbviewer-disabled: The Labki database viewer is currently disabled by the site administrator.
labkipackmanager-list-empty: No packs found in the manifest.
labkipackmanager-ui-no-packs: No packs available for the selected source. Click Load or Refresh.
labkipackmanager-status-missing: No cached manifest found. Click 'Grab Manifest' to fetch.
labkipackmanager-error-fetch: Failed to fetch content pack manifest.
labkipackmanager-error-parse: Failed to parse content pack manifest (YAML error).
labkipackmanager-error-schema: Manifest format is invalid or missing required fields.
labkipackmanager-error-schema-version: Manifest is missing a valid schema_version.
labkipackmanager-error-unknown: An unexpected error occurred while loading the manifest.
labkipackmanager-error-permission: You do not have permission to manage Labki packs.
labkipackmanager-error-repo-not-found: The specified repository could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-not-found: The specified pack could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-page-not-found: The specified page could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-missing: Manifest file (manifest.yml) not found in worktree.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-empty: Manifest file exists but is empty.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-unreadab: Manifest file exists but cannot be read (permission denied).
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-read: Failed to read manifest file from worktree.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-url: The provided URL is not a valid repository URL.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-protocol: The URL protocol is not supported. Use https, http, git, or ssh.
labkipackmanager-error-repo-multiple-ide: Cannot specify both repo_id and repo_url. Please provide only one identifier.
labkipackmanager-error-ref-multiple-iden: Cannot specify both ref_id and ref. Please provide only one identifier.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-multiple-ide: Cannot specify both pack_id and pack. Please provide only one identifier.
labkipackmanager-error-ref-requires-repo: A repository must be specified (repo_id or repo_url) when filtering by ref.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-requires-ref: A ref must be specified (ref_id or ref) when filtering by pack name.
labkipackmanager-error-ref-not-found: The specified ref could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-repo-required: A repository must be specified (repo_id or repo_url).
labkipackmanager-error-ref-required: A ref must be specified (ref_id or ref).
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-packs: Invalid or empty packs parameter. Must be a JSON-encoded array.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-pack-form: Pack format is invalid. Each pack must have 'name' and 'pages' fields.
labkipackmanager-error-worktree-not-foun: Worktree not found for the specified ref. Please sync the repository first.
labkipackmanager-error-missing-pack-depe: Cannot install packs: missing required dependencies: $1. Please include these packs in your installation request or install them first.
labkipackmanager-api-repos-list-param-re: Optional repository ID to fetch a single repository. Mutually exclusive with repo_url.
Optional repository URL to fetch a single repository. The URL will be normalized before lookup. Mutually exclusive with repo_id.
apihelp-labkireposlist-description: Returns information about configured content repositories, including their associated refs (branches/tags), sync status, and metadata.
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-all: List all content repositories with their refs
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-by-id: Get details for repository with ID 1
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-by-url: Get details for repository by URL
labkipackmanager-api-packs-list-param-re: Optional repository ID to filter packs. Mutually exclusive with repo_url.
Optional repository URL to filter packs. The URL will be normalized before lookup. Mutually exclusive with repo_id.
Optional ref ID to filter packs. Mutually exclusive with ref. Requires a repository to be specified.
Optional ref name (branch/tag) to filter packs. Mutually exclusive with ref_id. Requires a repository to be specified.
labkipackmanager-api-packs-list-param-pa: Optional pack ID to filter to a specific pack. Mutually exclusive with pack.
Optional pack name to filter to a specific pack. Mutually exclusive with pack_id. Requires ref to be specified.
labkipackmanager-api-packs-list-param-in: If true, includes page data nested within each pack. Default is false (pack metadata only).
apihelp-labkipackslist-summary: List and query installed content packs.
apihelp-labkipackslist-description: Returns information about installed content packs, including their pages, metadata, and installation status. Can be filtered by repository, ref, or specific pack.
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-all: List all installed packs across all repositories and refs
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-by-repo-i: Get packs for repository with ID 1
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-by-repo-u: Get packs for repository by URL
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-by-ref: Get packs for a specific ref (by name)
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-by-ref-id: Get packs for a specific ref (by ID)
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-pack-page: Get pages for a specific pack
apihelp-labkipackslist-example-pack-by-i: Get pages for a pack by pack ID
labkipackmanager-api-packs-install-param: Repository ID. Mutually exclusive with repo_url.
Repository URL. Mutually exclusive with repo_id.
Ref ID. Mutually exclusive with ref.
Ref name (branch/tag). Mutually exclusive with ref_id.
JSON-encoded array of pack definitions. Each pack must have 'name' and 'pages' fields.
apihelp-labkipacksinstall-summary: Install one or more content packs.
apihelp-labkipacksinstall-description: Queues a background job to install packs from a repository ref. Returns an operation ID for tracking progress.
labkipackmanager-api-packs-remove-param-: Repository ID. Mutually exclusive with repo_url.
Repository URL. Mutually exclusive with repo_id.
Ref ID. Mutually exclusive with ref.
Ref name (branch/tag). Mutually exclusive with ref_id.
JSON-encoded array of pack IDs to remove.
If true, deletes the MediaWiki pages associated with the packs. Default is false (registry only).
apihelp-labkipacksremove-summary: Remove/uninstall one or more content packs.
apihelp-labkipacksremove-description: Queues a background job to remove packs from a repository ref. Returns an operation ID for tracking progress.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-pack-ids: Invalid or empty pack_ids parameter. Must be a JSON-encoded array.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-pack-id-f: Pack ID format is invalid. Each pack_id must be a positive integer.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-wrong-ref: Pack '$1' does not belong to the specified ref.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-has-dependen: Cannot remove packs: other installed packs depend on them: $1
